ratings.comment: She was the worst professor I've ever had in college even after taking four semesters of chem. Her expectations are unclear and the exams were unfair, we never knew what to expect. She never communicated with TAs, my friends and I were always told different things in our discussions. Stats should not be this hard of a class.

I was sick and provided her with a doctor's note. I had passed out from illness and developed strep throat twice, to which she only gave me 24 hours to make up for the exam I had missed. Clearly doesn't care about students well being or health. I would never take class with her again. She clearly doesn't understand that we are not robots.
Poorly structured and taught class that actually makes it insanely difficult to grasp. Please do not take this class if you can avoid it.

Gloria is a good prof.-Yea lecture is boring(and recorded) but I think she does a good job of explaining concepts and examples. This stats isn't too difficult, but YOU still need to be intentional with taking the time to understand the material. Do problems from the textbook, complete homework/disc. worksheets, ask questions, and you will be fine.
DO NOT take her course.
Regret taking this class, lecture heaving, and practically only graded on exams. Homework assignments are such a mess, and so are discussions. My TA wouldn't even show up half the time, ridiculous.

Gloria's lectures were well organized and easy to follow since she posted the content beforehand. The grading is very clear, and she tries to give as many points back as possible. She's a very caring professor and answers questions after class and during office hours.

I don't believe that the content covered in this course is fundamentally challenging material. The quality of instruction, however, was so poor and dispassionate that I struggled to learn and perform. Lectures were mind numbing. No one seems to know what is going on, including the professor.

Lectures are not helpful-talks in circles. She is very difficult to understand and TA save or break you. Homework is due Friday nights and ruins your entire night and day. Using piazza is pointless as her responses are equivalent to her repeating the question if she gets to the question before the Ta's.
Awful...
Tons of lecture material to cover, but if you stay caught up it isn't terrible. Gloria is very nice but this class is quite difficult. Definitely focus on lecture material and homeworks.

2 midterms worth 20% each and a final worth 30%. She has 2 grading scales: the normal and percentiles. The top 25% get an A and in my semester that went down to an 88%. You are required to purchase the textbook but I found a free online version; if you look up "freeman pisani purves statistics textbook pdf" it should be the first link.

I had an average of above 90% on all the homeworks and quizzes and it still didn't matter. I reached out to the professor for help and she offered no advice. Her lectures move too fast and do not give you time to learn the material. The exams cover such specific topics that make it impossible to study for due to the amount of course material.

People complain, but not that bad. Lecture moves fast, but if you stay up to date with the material it makes sense. There is one HW/week, graded on correctness, so get quizlet plus to check answers. Also weekly quizzes, but easy, only 5 pts. Exams on canvas and mix of mc/short answer, not super hard. TA/textbook can answer almost every question.

Gloria Mendoza is likely one of the most emotionally absent, rude, and poor instructors that I've had. Statistically speaking (she is a stats professor), she is the professor most likely to hurt your feelings. She was average (AT BEST) in lecture, and a tough grader. She made me never want to hear the word statistics again or attend office hours.

This class was definitely difficult. Lectures moved really fast and section wasn't super helpful, but luckily everything was recorded so you can go back and re-watch. Gloria cares a lot but sometimes the material just gets lost.

Gloria is an OK professor. The lectures aren't great, however, the fill-in-the-blank notes provided with the lectures outline exactly what you need to know for the weekly homework assignments. Definitely utilize the drop-in stats tutoring provided by the school for help on the homework assignments. Professor makes it clear what will be on the exams

Wow, one of my worst experiences at UW-Madison. Lazy lectures, could barely understand what she was saying. Don't even bother going to lecture you won't learn anything anyway. Pray you get a good TA, otherwise you will be figuring this stuff out on your own. Seems like a nice lady but is an incompetent professor.

Lectures are very hard to follow, Professor Mendoza can be hard to understand, there is seemingly no cohesive plan for the semester, nothing is connected. Not only are the lectures too fast, but even if the were slower, none of the content flows well together. I did not expect to pull multiple all-nighters.

This class was pretty challenging. There was a lot of work (two quizzes + group activity + homework every week, two midterms, and a final exam), and I still felt like I didn't learn much this year. The lectures aren't very helpful, so you'll have to teach yourself if you're not math-inclined. Honorlock exams with open-note but still super tough.

Admittedly, she's gotten bad ratings, and I too am guilty of complaining, but she's not nearly as bad as everyone says. It's not a hard class, but you can't pass by doing nothing. As long as you understand your homework answers and such, even if you get them wrong, and you take decent notes (I never watched lecture), you're good. She's very nice.

Worst class i've ever taken. The exams are open note but VERY hard. the lectures are pre-posted but make no sense, the TA's are no help. I would never recommend anyone to ever take this class with this professor.

Many complain about the lack of organization & while she can be confusing, she responds to Piazza, emails, and talks after class. She can be hard to understand but she knows statistics & is always willing to offer additional help. You can get an A if you put some work in and complete extra credit. Also, reach out to her - she wants you to succeed.

Very unwilling to answer questions. Does not give answers to any test prep so it is extremely hard to study for exams. TAs and Professor are never on the same page so they don't know how to help. Do not take this course with this professor unless you already have a strong background.

Course expectations are often unclear, content is communicated very poorly, general communication between Professor and TA, professor and students, and TA and students is lacking. TA didn't know the answers to or see the exams before or after students took them, students are not given the tools to succeed in this course. Would't recommend at all.
Expectations of class are very unclear. Communication is a major barrier.
